moves.1. e4 c5 2. Nf3 g6 3. d4 Bg7 4. d5 d6: all in a days' work; from Sicilian to Ben Oni style...
moves.5. Nc3 Nf6 6. Be2 a6 7. a4 Qa5 8. Nd2 O-: this move - clearly to avoid b5 - cancels out most of White's opening advantage...
moves.9... Nbd7 10. Nc4 Qc7 11. O-O Rb8 12. a5: not the best move; better was f4 or b3...
moves.19... Bxc3 20. bxc3: clearly a mistake; Rxc3 was much better than this ugly move...
moves.22. Qd4 e5 23. Qd5+ Qxd5 24. Rxd5 Rf6 25: again, too ambitious; best was Rdd1, Nc5, Bg5, Rxd1...
moves.25... Nc5 26. Ba3: after f3, Nxe4!, Bxc4, Kh8, White is in enough trouble as it is; this takes the cake...
moves.26... Rxf1+ 27. Bxf1 Bb7 28. Rd1: too late to back out; much needed was Rxc5, dxc5, Bxc4+ or at least Bxc4, Bxd5, Bxd5+...
moves.28... Nxe4 29. Bxc4+ d5: much sharper and clearer than Kg7, Rb1, Ba8, Rb8, d5...
moves.30. Bxd5+ Bxd5 31. Rxd5 Rxf2 32. h3 Re2: looking for trouble; better was Kh1...
moves.39. Ra6+ Kf5 40. Be7: best was g4; for a little while now...
moves.40... Rxg2+ 41. Kh1 Rxc2 42. Rf6+ Ke4 43: this ends all; much needed was Rxg6, Rxc3, Kh2...
moves.43... Rc1+: White resigns: all is over after Kh2, Ng4+, Kg2 (Kg3, Rxc3+), Nxf6, Bxf6, Rxc3...
